Description: Rim sherd of Gnathia ware pottery skyphos; inside glazed; outside, at rim, white tongues, with incised outline and intersticial white dots, between pairs of incised lines; below horizontal band of alternating added red and yellow sections. Ancient repair hole.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: van de Wiel 1968 / Verzameling ceramiek en Terracotta's Archaeologisch Instituut der Rijksuniversiteit Leiden (p. 14, N 47, pl. 2, N 47)
Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (p. 70, no. 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GR.01)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: T.2982 (Musée Scheurleer (The Hague) Registration number)
